page.title: 12TOURISM IN & AROUND YALDING
page.content: Architecturally Yalding, and especially the High Street, is one of the gems of the Wealden area and visitors come to admire it. Some tourists visit Yalding because of the late Edmund Blunden's association with the village. Churches at Yalding and Nettlestead also attract visitors. Both Yalding and West Farleigh are on one of the springtime "blossom routes", coach loads of tourists coming to admire the apple, cherry, pear and plum blossom. A route designated "Heart of Kent Country Tour" is now signposted. Both at Wateringbury and Yalding the river Medway brings visitors in summer months. Yalding Lees (mostly to the south of the block) is a recreational area which attracts visitors.
